captions.text:
From Guillermo del Toro, the Latino Peter
Jackson, comes a completely original sci-fi

universe that doesn't rely on any pre-existing
franchise.
... as long as you don't count Transformers,
that stupid Hugh Jackman robot boxing movie,

When giant aliens emerge from this iTunes
visualizer at the bottom of the ocean, the

entire world's resources will be spent on
building giant robots to punch them in the face.

But these machines are only as good as their
two pilots, who for no reason at all must

be connected by an overly-complicated neural
bridge to ensure drift compatibility,

a system so advanced only family members can
do it.
Or just one guy by himself.
This makes no sense - but it sure looks cool!

Meet Raleigh Becket, a hot-shot pilot struggling
to maintain his American accent

"All those years I spent living in the past,
I never really thought about the future."

And his co-pilot, Mako Mori, a girl so bad
at speaking English

"I've studied your fighting techniques and
strategy."
sometimes she just gives up mid-sentence.

Watch as these two awkwardly flirt in the
classic will-they-won't-they relationship.

Then, for the first time in movie history...
WON'T.
Suit up with these bad ass fighting robots.
And this one named after a stripper.

and an incredibly powerful sword they forgot
they had until about two thirds of the way

... Probably should've busted that out at
the beginning of the movie. Don't you think?

Ride along with a Marshal, an ex-pilot
forced to take cancer-causing future Altoids

but no amount of future cancer can stop him
from giving the most awesome speech since

"Today we face the monsters that are at our
door and bring the fight to them. Today we

So relive the summer's guiltiest pleasure
that's either the most awesome dumb movie
or the dumbest awesome movie ever made.
using shipping crates as brass knuckles
using a freighter like a baseball bat

Let's be honest: that movie was super dumb.
But I still cannot wait for the sequel.
"60% of the time, it works every time!"

"I'm not locked in here with you. You're locked
in here with me."

comments.author: Alex Rodriguez

comments.text:
The whole plot of that movie was just everyone making the stupidest fucking 
choices until the last possible second.
Let's punch the monster. Oh ok we're getting our asses handed to us? Just 
smoke him with the missiles and giant plasma cannons that we had the whole 
time.
Let's divert all of the funding from the giant robot program into a giant 
wall instead. What, the monsters walked right through it? Lol whatever back 
to robots.
Let's punch the monsters again. Oh shit that's still not working? Kill them 
with the mega sword that we had the whole time.﻿

comments.author: Joe Pesci

comments.text:
This movie was heavily Evangellion inspired. People cant act like it wasnt. 
The whole drift thing was originally Evangellions idea. The whole naturally 
good pilot that dosent want to pilot thremecha but does it anyway (Shinji)
The wholea Tsundare has a deep connection with the main character 
(Ayanami). When i watched it i immediatly saw the resemblence. They should 
have just called the Kaijus (fun fact: kaiju is japanese for giant monster 
and a abreviation of Dai-Kaiju) Angels and the Jaegers, Evas and made a 
live action evangellion movie
﻿
